intro: Psilosiphon zambeziacus, commonly known as the Zambezi water fern, is a aquatic plant native to the wetlands of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Salviniaceae and is characterized by its floating fronds that are divided into small, needle-like segments. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often forming dense mats on the water surface. Its reproductive structures include small, spore-producing organs called sporangia, which are typically found on the underside of its fronds. Psilosiphon zambeziacus plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen to aquatic life.
